intro: Lobelia rosmarinifolia, commonly known as rosemary lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, needle-like leaves and clusters of blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and has a pleasant, herbaceous scent. Lobelia rosmarinifolia is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
